Who knew the Cyberlife logo would make the scariest
Why are there just pumpkin pieces outside your door?
I got annoyed while carving it and thought pieces would
I like it. I don't know what it is, but I like it.
Looks like modern, abstract art. I hadn't thought of
putting it on a pumpkin though.
Okay, just a second and... here.
There we go, loud and clear. What's up?
Sorry to bother you. It's just that I was curious as to
what you were up to. We've gotten Markus all set, and I
was thinking about meeting you wherever you are.
Uh... that might not be the best idea. I mean won't it
Yeah, we're kind of trying to get information from Monika,
and she might not be as forthcoming with you.
Oh... you're right. I forget sometimes that this much
authority can be intimidating. I mean, Jack, you can
do more than I can, but... I understand.
Oh no, it's okay. It's not that I don't want you here, but
Monika's been trying to keep this secret, so it might
not be a good idea to let on that you know about the
Well yes, but I wasn't going to say that. Out loud.
Right. Sorry. Lost myself there for a second.
Actually, if you don't mind, I have a question.
Well... have the girls from DDLC been acting strangely?
Monika seemed to indicate that she couldn't get in contact
with them. And it's pretty clear that they were all involved.
Yeah, you know. Mad at her? Or maybe a better question
is have you seen them around?
Now that you mention it, there has been something kind of
I bartend at Taters Please every Saturday afternoon,
and Sayori always comes in to get lunch for her and her
friends. But these last two Saturdays, it's been Monika
She said it was because Sayori was busy decorating the
Literature Club. And she forgot to mention to take the
pickles off of Yuri's sandwich. That's always made
You don't think she's covering for them disappearing,
do you? Because that's the kinda thing you'd want
Well actually, people have been disappearing for months
now. And since they're all tied up in the you-know-what,
Keeping it on the down low to stop Anti. Damn, that's
I wish they had come to me earlier. I would have let
them bend the rules if it meant putting an end to this.
You've always been kind of a stickler for the rules, so
I don't really blame them for being all secretive.
Well, that is my job. But Anti's flaunting his new
powers. \fiMy\fi powers. So I can certainly let one or
Well, that's not exactly helpful to us now. No offense.
You said I'm more powerful than you. How come? Like what
can I do that you can't?
Oh, a lot! You can install and uninstall programs, edit any
code you want, un-delete things, rearrange where the games
are stored, create new user accounts, switch the internet
on and off, pet real cats... a lot of things!
Wait, that has nothing to do with computers.
Doesn't make it any less true.
And yet I'm still stuck here?
Well, technically, you can leave. Any time you want. It's
just that you haven't decided to. And as for coming here,
that's kind of up in the air. No one's done it except
Billy, that I know of. I'm sure I could figure it out.
Oh yeah, I could just log us all out. Then why can't I
You'd have to be able to know exactly where you're teleporting
to, genius. That takes knowing where things are in Wireland.
Anyway, what were you saying, Mack?
Umm... well, all I can really do is keep things moving
smoothly. You know, prevent games from crashing, step in
for any characters who go missing, fix bugs before you
get there, and generally keep Byte'on pretty organised.
Wow. That's still a lot of stuff.
Without a doubt. But it would be disastrous in Anti's
hands, so please figure this out as soon as you can!
Yes, right! We should meet with Monika then. I guess
Bye, Jack. Please try to fix this.
Guess we've got to go back in.
